Package client

Interface ClientHandler

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    PentagoClientHandler
    public interface ClientHandler
extends java.lang.Runnable
    Client handler communicates with a client connected to the server. It responds to client's messages and also provides an opportunity to join server sessions (e.g. for playing a game).
    Author:
    Aliaksei Kouzel

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void close()
      Disconnect the client from the server.
      Player getPlayer()
      Get a player instance of the client.
      ServerProtocol getProtocol()
      Get the server protocol.
      java.lang.String getUsername()
      Get the client username.
      void handleMessage​(java.lang.String message)
      Handle a message sent by the client.
      boolean joinSession​(GameSession session)
      Join a game session on the server.
      void leaveSession()
      Leave from a game session that the client is currently assigned to.
      void ping()
      Check the connection with the client by sending a ping message.
      void sendMessage​(MessageType type, java.lang.String... args)
      Send a message to the client.

        void leaveSession()
        Leave from a game session that the client is currently assigned to.

      • ping

        void ping()
        Check the connection with the client by sending a ping message. The other party must immediately respond with a pong message.

        Disconnect the client from the server.
